name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Reno

reviews.text: I was attending a conference in Reno and I stayed at Holiday Inn Express for four days. I was very impressed with the room and service quality. The staff are very friendly and always courteous. The location is also very ideal - a few minutes from RNO and downtown Reno. The room itself is very good - nice, clean and spacious. Free wireless is very reliable.
reviews.title: Excellent stay, great service

reviews.text: The highlight for me had to be the breakfast buffet. I travel quite a bit and stay in hotels, and this by far has to be the best buffet (especially its free). Overall, very nice impressions of the hotel. Only negative I can think of is that I could hear my next room neighbor snore :(. Other than that, highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great, brand new hotel - a little tricky to find but very convenient and well-designed and kept.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights on a recent quick trip and found this property to be one of the nicest Holiday Inn Express & Suites I've visited.
reviews.title: Good Accomodation

reviews.text: The lobby is very nice and the free breakfast in the morning is the standard HIE&S fare including their signature cinnamon rolls. I was a little surprised by the variation in egg dishes though, one morning being scrambled eggs but the next being egg and cheese omelets.
reviews.title: Spacious rooms, great location

reviews.text: The room was very comfortable and well-kept. The bed was comfortable and felt of recent vintage, there were a good selection of pillows in the room and the TV was a nice recent Sony Bravia LCD model with a complement of SD and HD channels along with several "Music Choice" audio-only channels available. The showers were very nice with a good, strong spray capable of actually washing off shampoo and soap, and there were no temperature issues at all. There was a nice fridge in the room hidden away in a cabinet, so if you can't find it at first, listen for it. :-)
reviews.title: Nice rooms, strange location

reviews.text: The lobby, and the room we stayed in are beautiful. The pool area was small. Breakfast was great and the woman attending the breakfast was efficient isn't and friendly. One small complaint is that I could hear the man next door hacking up his morning phlegm while I was in the bathroom. That's. A little too personal for my taste. The location is in an business/industrial area without gas or food nearby. We drove under the freeway and up a few blocks to have the buffet at the Grand Sierra Casino. Several other option s for food there too. Before leaving the room I thought to check the window as we were on the ground floor and found it unlocked. Not sure why it was but I would recommend checking that out. Overall we had a pleasant stay and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Very nice rooms, odd location

reviews.text: PS to the mgmt-- we stayed in a handicapped accessible room. The shower and access to the room seem narrow for walkers or wheelchairs. Also the soap/shampoo shelf in the shower is tiny. My stuff fell off a few times, and if I were handicapped I might have a tough time getting it up off the floor again.
reviews.title: Will NEVER stay there again

reviews.text: When we made our reservations we asked specifically asked if they had a pool and hot tub, they do but you would think they would tell us the city came and told them their chemicals are at dangerous levels so they shut down the hot tub. Also the door near room 146 slams shut all night. Management told me the city shut down the hot tub and that the doors were working fine. LIES!! Terrible customer service.
reviews.title: Best Stay I ever Had

reviews.text: Awesome Experience here, As soon as I checked in I was welcomed with smiles and friendly attitude. Came in to town for the weekend to do a little gamble and was shuttled to and from hotel to the casino with no problem. Driver was so nice. The best part to me is I felt I was treated like family and not just like a guest which made it so much better. great job to management who seems to have staff happy and willing to be working for them. I will be back to my home here at the Holiday Inn once in reno
reviews.title: “Beautiful, very affordable and comfortable.”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautifully decorated. Magnificent place. Pet Friendly. Breakfast buffet with new pancake machine. This was the last stop of a very long car trip and it was the nicest place I've stayed in a long time.
reviews.title: Great dog friendly hotel

reviews.text: Stayed overnight to catch an early flight home. Clean. Slept well. No complaints! To-go breakfast sacks would've been nice for those with really early flights.
reviews.title: No complaints!

reviews.text: Travelers who have stayed at several Holiday Inn Express locations know that quality varies considerably from one location to the next. This particular property is far and away the most beautiful Holiday Inn Express that I've ever seen, hotel staff were very helpful, the breakfast was good, and there were several other nice touches (e.g., apples were available at all times of day).
reviews.title: best Holiday Inn Express that I've ever stayed at

reviews.text: The following is NOT a complaint: I'd like to see Holiday Inn Express add some sort of non-pork meat option (e.g., turkey sausages) to the breakfast.
reviews.title: It was OK; new but noisy

reviews.text: As other reviewers noted, the hotel was nice. It was new and clean. Employees at the hotel were nice and polite, service was good. However, it was not quiet as other reviewers noted. The hotel is literally accross the street from a major highway. Our room was on the north (?) side of the hotel and the road noise was too loud for us; it was hard to sleep. Also, the A/C unit was exteremly load. Again, it made it hard to sleep. Overall it was OK.
reviews.title: Great value pet friendly and family friendly hotel

reviews.text: On a move across country we stayed two nights at the HI Express Reno. The hotel was very attractive with a nice lobby and high ceilings. The rooms we had were very good with up to date decor and comfortable beds. The pillows were a bit soft for my taste. The hotel had very reasonable pet policies. The one downside is that the location is right off the freeway so pretty loud traffic noise, and it's in an industrial area so there is absolutely no greenspace or greenery to be found on the hotel property or even nearby. Kind of hard on the pooch. The breakfast was solid with a decent amount of healthy choices alongside the cinnamon rolls, pancakes and bacon. The swimming pool is small but very clean. It was popular with the kids and provided a good break from the summer heat. The value for this hotel was terrific, definitely worth the very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Will return to his hotel again...

reviews.text: Loved the look. Rooms smell great. I always stay at Holiday Inn Expresses but this one blew me away! Front desk guy was not the nicest, but the room made up for it. Lovely!
reviews.title: Brand New Everything

reviews.text: I was here this weekend once again visiting family and doing a little shopping and we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express & Suites on Market St. This hotel is super clean. The staff is always so nice to me. They go above and beyond for us. We spent like 3 hours in their indoor pool and it was wonderful. Those omelettes they have during breakfast are awesome! We dont have to spend any money they have a great breakfast. I love this hotel it is simply the best!
reviews.title: The Cleanest Hotel in Reno!

reviews.text: I'm giving the Holiday Inn Express five stars out of five. By doing so, I do not intend to suggest that is a five-star hotel. It isn't. It's a Holiday Inn Express. It's no frills, little service. No doormen. No one to help with one's bags. No on-site restaurant (although they do serve breakfast in the morning, but I don't care about breakfast and didn't bother to check it out). The fitness center is a couple of machines. No free weights, no bouncing ball. The pool is tiny, but one can do laps (short ones), and there is a hot tub.
reviews.title: Excellent Execution on a No-Frills Express Hotel

reviews.text: For what it is, the Holiday Inn Express in Reno is an excellent hotel. It is immaculately clean (brand-spanking new), with reasonably comfortable beds, flat screen televisions, mid-size mini-fridges in the rooms, and friendly employees. While I typically prefer to stay in a local place instead of a chain, I was swayed by the TripAdvisor reviews. They are fair and on point. The Holiday Inn Express, Hyatt Place, and the like, are all more-or-less the same type of express hotel with minimal service, and I imagine their rooms are comparable. Unfortunately, they are not located in great areas. There's nothing wrong the industrial automotive park that HIE sits in the middle of, across the highway and across from the airport. It's just not quaint or local, kind of generic, and one could be anywhere -- there was nothing "Reno" about this hotel or its location. That said, I didn't hear one airplane, I was not bothered by the freeway noise, and the halls were quiet. I asked for late-checkout, and they offered me until 2p, which was uniquely generous.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay.
Very nice and relaxing.
reviews.text: I wouldn't hesitate to stay at HIE in Reno again. They know what they're doing, and they do it quite well.

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Reno
description: Brand new in 2008, the Holiday Inn Express and Suites in Reno is just minutes away from the Reno Tahoe International Airport . Nestled at the base of the Sierra Nevada Mountains, the hotel is conveniently located off US-395 and a half mile south of I-80. he hotel features complimentary wired and wireless high-speed internet, a meeting room, a hot breakfast buffet served daily, a health and fitness center, business center, guest laundry, indoor pool and whirlpool. The Reno area will keep you fully entertained with a variety of activities such as skiing, boating, golfing, snowshoeing, hiking, mountain biking, and kayaking. So Stay Smart!
